thread.title: Judge edges Roman, 1-0, in clash of unbeatens
thread.title_full: Judge edges Roman, 1-0, in clash of unbeatens

title: Judge edges Roman, 1-0, in clash of unbeatens
text:
The fans knew it too, so they lined up in droves at the corner of Crispin and Stanwood Streets. Parking was hard to come by.
Father Judge's 1-0 win did not disappoint. Just ask the large crowd the hard-fought battle attracted. 
"It was spectacular," Judge senior Kevin Ceno said. "The fans made it 10 times better than what it would have been. It was just a great atmosphere." 
Ceno got the crowd going early, when he put the lone goal away in the seventh minute. He applied heavy pressure to the defense of Roman Catholic, forcing an error and sending the ball into the back of the net. 
Then it was up to the defensive tandem of McCarthy and Shane Holmes to make sure the Cahillites (13-1-2, 9-1-1) wouldn't equalize. The terrific senior duo did just that, and the Crusaders (16-0, 11-0) recorded their 12th shutout. 
Fans for both teams easily filled the eight small bleachers at the facility. They also lined up from end line to end line - and then some - along the side of the field. In some sections, fans were standing four or five deep. 
More lined up on an incline behind one goal, and some were even outside of the fence, their bodies pressed up against it, peering through the holes to watch. 
With the conference playoffs starting Tuesday, the teams seem to think they are on another collision course. 
"That's what I'm looking forward to, honestly," McCarthy said. "I'd love a rematch in the championship." 
Sounds like something the fans would like, too. 
Roman Catholic 0 0 - 0 
Home 1 0 - 1
